The application is prepared to have several libraries, with at least one standard library and other customized ones being considered, which are also separated between books and mangas/comics.
Configuration is simple, just select a standard library in the desired sector settings.
And if necessary, you can add other libraries that will be analyzed when you enter the library. You can even activate or deactivate the libraries.
After configuring the library\'s main folder, the application will analyze the files in the informed folder, identifying the mangas/comics that have the extension such as cbr/rar, cbz/zip and tar.
These files will then be displayed in list format and can be deleted or added to favorites.

For better performance, a copy of the first page will be kept, which will be displayed as the cover, it will be necessary due to the limitation of rar/cbr files in using much of the computational resource available only for the display of a single page.

Libraries can be displayed in several ways, such as a simple list, a simple grid or with a separator, which will be grouped according to the order of the list, i.e. grouped by author, series, genre, date or last access.
It is possible to filter the library contents, performing a simple query by file name or title, or by some attributes that are imported from the book or manga/comics (ComicInfo).

The compound search will always start with the letter @ and will continue with the attribute such as author, series, type and volume for example, and its content will show a suggestion according to the attributes according to the library files that are available in the library.
It is possible to concatenate several attributes, separating them with spaces and adding a new attribute.
At the end of all the selected attributes, it is still possible to add a simple search, which will search by the name or title of the file.

By long-pressing, you can display file details, which will show information about the manga/comic or book, as well as series, author, volume, among others. It will also display the chapters and folders of the file or subtitles that the file may have. It also has the functionality integrated with MyAnimelist to obtain information about the volume and others that may also be of interest.

There are two types of readers, one for manga/comics and the other for books. In both cases, they have the same features, but with specific situations for books, where you will have markings in text and pages, as well as analysis of Japanese texts to help with a kanji dictionary.

As for mangas/comics, it has integration with OCR and printing of extracted and translated texts in json, as well as the simultaneous opening of two different books that will be described below. Both have a marking of the last page opened in the reading so that you can continue where you left off..

To make it easier to use, the name of the page that is currently being displayed will be displayed below the file name. This will be very useful for identifying which caption to select when the automatic selection does not work.

The manga/comics reader has some features, such as bookmarking, current page and page count, as well as chapter markers that can be imported from ComicInfo or chapter identification separated by folders.
The quick shortcut buttons allow you to switch to the previous or next file, OCR the page, enhance colors or night mode that applies a reddish tone to the pages to avoid eye strain.
It also has a floating popup with the main action buttons or the switch between images in two files that are open simultaneously to facilitate reading and understanding in different languages.

With a long tap, you can display a zoom of the page that will always be in one of the corners of the screen so as not to interfere with reading. A double tap will toggle the zoom of the page, but this can also be adjusted with the pinch command with two fingers on the screen.
When you tap the bottom center, a list of pages will be displayed, so you can easily find the desired page.
When clicking on the title, a simple list of all available chapters will be displayed with their description, which can be from the ComicInfo file or the name of the folder.

If you want more information with separation between chapters, in the top menu there is a button called "Chapter List", which will open a screen with a list of sections divided between chapters and thumbnail images of the pages.

Another feature of the reader is the simultaneous opening of two files, where with just one click it is possible to switch between the same pages in two different languages, only needing to link the pages once.

As two files may have different amounts of images, and double pages may also occur, the application is prepared to work with these differences, where the linked file may have a list of images that were not linked and ended up being left over, or join two pages to form one.

To link pages, simply drag and drop, and the pages in the sequence will automatically organize themselves. If the page does not exist in the original file, it may be added to the list of unlinked pages.

There are controls that will help you reorder the images, organize them into double pages or an automatic organization that will try to find the chapters of the original file and leave the images of the destination file starting with the same images of the chapter, where the excess will be added to the unlinked list.

With this feature, while reading each page, simply click the link button to switch between pages, in which the application will even maintain the zoom and scrolling proportion of the page so that it remains correctly in the current position and has less impact on the reading pace. To avoid having to open the menu, the floating action popup also has a button for this purpose.

The book reader has some features, such as page marking, highlighting text within the page, searching for words throughout the book and displaying the chapters present in the book, as well as chapter markings on the progress bar.
It is also possible to change the spacing, font and letter size in each file, but if you do not have it, it will be obtained from the default configuration.
When selecting text on the page, you can highlight the text, which will be saved and shared along with the book\'s reading information.
You can even add notes to the selected text, or change the colors of the markings.
Notes are easily found in the book menu, where you can identify all the notes that have been made or pages that have been marked.
For greater convenience, there is a main menu, where you can see all the notes made separated by books, which allows you to easily open it on the marking page.
Just like the manga/comic reader, the book has a menu that will display the pages in thumbnails separated by chapters.
Another feature is kanji recognition for Japanese books, which highlights kanji with colors that differ according to the jlpt level and imports vocabulary if desired.
Along with importing vocabulary, you can activate text processing that will display the kanji furigana to aid reading in Japanese.
When you click on any kanji, a popup will be displayed with the definition and meaning of the kanji and other relevant information.

The app is able to load properly formatted json files with texts that were previously extracted from the pages, along with the texts the file can also contain a list of vocabularies in which it can be recognized and located in the display.
The main screen of subtitles will be the import, where it will show the chapters that contain the file and a json file with the subtitles can also be imported.
The first field will be used to load an external subtitle file, which will overwrite the subtitle that was embedded in the file.

The second field will contain a listing of the chapters found both in the file and in the external json that was chosen, when selecting a certain chapter the application will fill in the data in the caption tab.

The third field will be responsible for the language that will be switched, it will overwrite the language defined in the settings screen, it will be used so that it can be easily switched between another language that may be listed.
After selecting the caption, you will be automatically directed to the caption tab, this tab will manage the content of the selected caption and will display the text.

The first field on the tab will contain the selected page within the caption and can be changed at any time. For ease of use, the field contains, in addition to the sequential number of pages in the chapter, the name of the original page from which the caption was processed.
Each button on this screen will perform the same function as the popup menu, when held down for a while the button will present a brief description of what it does.

It performs the exchange between subtitles of different languages in which they were informed in the configuration screen. In an example you can switch between Japanese and English subtitles with just one click and the application will automatically find the corresponding chapter and page in the target language.

It draws the coordinates from which the texts that are in the subtitle file were extracted, it will also add the sequential number of the text to better identify which order it is. More information in the section below about the floating popup.

Search the selected page within the subtitle file, each subtitle file will contain the name and a hash of the page which will be used in the search to find the selected page. The search will find both the chapter and the corresponding page.
Forwards or backwards the selected text.
The subtitle file can contain a list of vocabularies and will be displayed in this tab, the list corresponds to each page processed, where it will always be updated when changing the page.
The application uses the powerful feature provided by sudachi for word recognition within text. This makes it possible to locate the meaning of each word within a vocabulary list.
The application has kanji recognition in which it queries an internal database that contains 3000 kanji with their main readings and meaning.
To use it, in the legend tab, just click on the kanji and a popup with information will be displayed.

The floating popup is a resource for better visualization of the obtained texts, it will create a screen directly in the operating system which can facilitate its visualization even in split screen, as it can be anywhere on the screen.

It will have all the main features that the subtitle setup menu, page information, control buttons and vocabulary directly into its content. With a simple click on a word in the text, the application will search the vocabulary for the word and show it to the user.
In addition to the control buttons this screen will also have a button to minimize the size of the popup, close it and move the entire scroll to the top.

With a touch on the right or upper corner it is possible to move the popup, it also accepts gestures, where inside the screen content dragging to the left will go to the next text and dragging to the right will return, a long click on the text will do copy it and double click it will go to the next one.
The application supports json files of english, portuguese and japanese languages.
The application keeps some statistics, such as the number of mangas/comics or books separated by sections, as well as the reading time and how much time was spent on each page.
It is also possible to check the amount of reading done annually separated by month on a graph. The graph can also be displayed according to libraries.

The application also has a theme functionality, which can be chosen from several available themes. It is also possible to keep the night theme according to the system or forced according to your choice.

The application may be sharing some information between two devices, for which it is only necessary to be logged in with a Google account. Page markings and notes made in books are shared, as well as some reading statistics.
Please give this app five stars if you like it, send us your opinion, it will be of great help. And if you wish, share this app with your friends.
Contact us and send you suggestions or praises about your experience with the app.
